asgn1SoccerCompetition

Class SoccerCompetition

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn1SoccerCompetition.SoccerCompetition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SportsCompetition

    public class SoccerCompetition
extends java.lang.Object
implements SportsCompetition
    A class to model a soccer competition. The competition contains one or more number of leagues, each of which contain a number of teams. Over the course a season matches are played between teams in each league. At the end of the season a premier (top ranked team) and wooden spooner (bottom ranked team) are declared for each league. If there are multiple leagues then relegation and promotions occur between the leagues.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alan Woodley

      • SoccerCompetition

        public SoccerCompetition(java.lang.String name,
                         int numLeagues,
                         int numTeams)
        Creates the model for a new soccer competition with a specific name, number of leagues and number of teams in each league
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the competition.
        numLeagues - The number of leagues in the competition.
        numTeams - The number of teams in each league.

    • Method Detail

      • getLeague

        public SoccerLeague getLeague(int leagueNum)
                       throws CompetitionException
        Retrieves a league with a specific number (indexed from 0). Returns an exception if the league number is invalid.
        Parameters:
        leagueNum - The number of the league to return.
        Returns:
        A league specified by leagueNum.
        Throws:
        CompetitionException - if the specified league number is less than 0. or equal to or greater than the number of leagues in the competition.

      • startSeason

        public void startSeason()
        Starts a new soccer season for each league in the competition.
        Specified by:
        startSeason in interface SportsCompetition

      • endSeason

        public void endSeason()
        Ends the season of each of the leagues in the competition. If there is more than one league then it handles promotion and relegation between the leagues.
        Specified by:
        endSeason in interface SportsCompetition
